subject: Re: [junit] Testing super-class contracts (test case reuse)
msgSnippet: ... This one works great for me: http://www.placebosoft.com/abstract-test.html I also have another write-up of the same pattern from a different author (they
messageBody:
> I would like to have a set of functional tests (black-box style) that
> enforce the behaviors of the super class, java.io.InputStream. Then use
> that same set of tests to ensure that the basic contracts for each of
> the classes I write follow that contract (i.e. pass those generic
> tests). Does anyone have a suggestion for doing this?

This one works great for me:
http://www.placebosoft.com/abstract-test.html

I also have another write-up of the same pattern from a different author
(they didn't know about each other's work). I don't have it handy, so let me
know if you're interested and I'll look it up for you.

---------------
Paolo Perrotta
Bologna, Italy
